HC Tang, Financial Enthusiast, Budgeting at The SocietyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 04 Mar 2019Both. 
1) Bonds: works like loan to a company. When equity goes down, bond increase will go up so you make more from this investment. Choose SSB as it's the safest now. 2) REITS: Company borrow $ to build and manage properties. Good to earn divident from REITS as it is quite attractive. However, when interest rate increases, their cost also increase due to REITS usually borrow a lot of $ to develop and run the property.From this you can see why need both so to cover both ends of the situation when equity up/ down and when interest increase and decrease.  You'll need more than just the above two. Check out more details on how to get a balance portfolio in Seedly blog post.0 comments0
